This splash was done by resident genius Alex Flores, and he wanted to give some props to a couple of our other illustrators that constantly go above and beyond in the pursuit of splash excellent. So, caught up in the arcade action, are the hapless [Chengwei Pan](https://www.artstation.com/artist/pan) and (in the background running fast) [Kelly Aleshire](https://www.artstation.com/artist/kaleshire).

Why is it that the splash artists and illustrators are not more publicly attached to their pieces? It seems like in order to find the credit for the work you need to do digging into things like ArtStations. Is this privicy reasons, or is there a sort of company rule where the splashes have to be branded more as property of LoL?

Riot has a 'manifesto' that lists five ideals we strive for. The fifth is 'Stay hungry, stay humble' and under that you'll find the following description:

We strive to be humbitious – ambitious and humble.
Complacency kills innovation, but ambition kills complacency.
We humbly seek and accept feedback.
We credit the larger team: the families, teammates and players who make it all possible.
And we believe there’s always more we can do for players.

So much in the same way attention isn't drawn to the engineers, tech-artists, dev managers etc. we don't credit any artists on the platform. Rather we focus on the product and the player experience. The reality is that everything we create is the result of a huge team effort and we want to remember that at all times. I'm quick to credit artists here on the forums if someone is looking for more of their work or wants to get in touch to ask about art etc. but they aren't contracted artists creating work in a vacuum, they're game developers working collaboratively to bring players an experience.

Working on LoL is a huge privilege, we are given the trust and expectations of millions of players around the world, and we want to always remember we get to do this because of you.

Huh, that was my first thought actually- A tribute to fellow Rioters.

This is awesome. :>
